content.description: Traverse left to right and then "top out" onto a big ledge. The problem starts on positive holds, continues through a couple of slopey crossovers and pulls the overhanging swing moves to finish.
content.location: Just around the corner to the southwest of "jugs". Use the pic for reference.

content.description: The South Side Traverse is the longest traverse of its grade in the area. With a length of over 150 feet, it is a great warm up for a day's session. Although some of the rock is sharp, the moves are great, and like much of the beach climbing, it provides variety as the sand levels change during the year. This traverse pretty much always has sand landings when others in the area don't. Becuase of the southern aspect, it can be warm and wind free on a sunny winter day. Try it both directions for different moves.
content.location: This traverse is located just west of the southern trail variation, on the south face of Houda Point.

content.description: One of the most classic problems on the beach. Traverse for 15 feet on giant jugs, starting from the far right side of the "jugs" boulder, swing off the "horn" hold to a sinker four finger pocket and top out up the center of the main face. Repeat until pumped.
content.location: Follow the beach trail north variation, walking under the overhanging north side of Houda Point until you see the north facing "jugs" boulder.

content.description:
the left version of this problem is v1 but the climb is over really sharp rock.

the right version of this problem is v2/3 squat/stand start; v5/6 sit start at the low striking crimp
content.protection: pads for the sharp rock(s), spotters
content.location: east face of the jugs boulder, to the left of 'no name'

content.description: warm up feet and fingers on this one arm reach to the top.
content.location: east face of the Jugs boulder, to the right/North of Pas Trop Vite

content.description: from start of houda crack traverse right to the arete. finish by sending the arete for the jug two hand match finish.
content.location: traverse the main wall to the right of Houda Crack

content.description: The Cave Direct is a sit start problem that starts as low as possible in the "cave" of the jugs boulder, then crosses the traversing line of "she's got jugs" and finishes up the face on crimps to the right of the "jugs" top out. The lower the sand the harder it gets.
content.location: Located on the Jugs boulder, just right of the "she's got jugs" top out.

content.description: traverse from left to right or right to left.
content.protection: pads can be used for the crux sections of this traverse but not necessary
content.location: very pronounced traverse section to the left of Houda Crack. it is the first bouldering problem on the main wall to your left as you walk off the stairs to the north side beach.

content.description:
begin at the volume

cut left to the jug to skip the first crux

or go left hand up to the pinch and cross right hand into the gaston for the direct line.

make it to the pinches

then the side pull

finish at first positive ledge feature

possible finish at the second left hand jug

really fun and difficult problem
content.location: this problem is on the overhanging section of the main wall, between the Houda Traverse and The Houda Crack.

content.description: fun problem. lots of key holds have broke over the years..
content.location: large crack at the main wall.

content.description: Hole in One is a fun problem on the "Jugs" boulder and a a must-do when running around the beach doing the V1-V3 circuit. "Hole" is a straight up problem about 6 feet to the left of the "She's Got Jugs" top out. Start on the lowest incut edges and follow these until they thin out. Get your feet high, reach left for a golf ball size, 2 finger pocket, lie back the pocket and latch the top finishing with a positive mantle.
content.location: 6 feet left of the "She's Got Jugs" top out.

content.description: sit start is difficult but the top out has really great holds
content.protection: pads, spotter, maybe a helmet for the rock behind you
content.location: north face of the overhanging rock inside the boulder cave, enter through the squeeze to the right of the main wall
